t: Shiggaion of David, which he sang unto the Lord, concerning the words of Cush the Benjamite.
O*p Lord*s my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that persecute me, and deliver me:
Lest*p he tear my soul like a lion, rending it in pieces, while there is none to deliver.
O*p Lord*s my God, if I have done this; if there be iniquity in my hands;
If*p I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:)
Let*p the enemy persecute my soul, and take it; yea, let him tread down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.
Arise,*p O Lord,*s in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the rage of mine enemies: and awake for me to the judgment that thou hast commanded.
So*p shall the congregation of the people compass thee about: for their sakes therefore return thou on high.
The*p Lord*s shall judge the people: judge me, O Lord,*s according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity that is in me.
Oh*p let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins.
My*p defence is of God, which saveth the upright in heart.
God*p judgeth the righteous, and God is angry with the wicked every day.
If*p he turn not, he will whet his sword; he hath bent his bow, and made it ready.
He*p hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors.
Behold,*p he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief, and brought forth falsehood.
He*p made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch which he made.
His*p mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent dealing shall come down upon his own pate.
I*p will praise the Lord*s according to his righteousness: and will sing praise to the name of the Lord*s most high.
